"name":"usdcToken","outputs":[{"internalType":"contract IERC20","name":"","type":"address"}],"stateMutability":"view","type":"function"}],"devdoc":{"details":"Holds the 20% upfront deposit from developers for their projects.      Funds are locked until the loan is completed (released) or defaulted (slashed).      Access is controlled via roles.","errors":{"AccessControlBadConfirmation()":[{"details":"The caller of a function is not the expected one. NOTE: Don't confuse with {AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount}."}],"AccessControlUnauthorizedAccount(address,bytes32)":[{"details":"The `account` is missing a role."}],"EnforcedPause()":[{"details":"The operation failed because the contract is paused."}],"ExpectedPause()":[{"details":"The operation failed because the contract is not paused."}],"ReentrancyGuardReentrantCall()":[{"details":"Unauthorized reentrant call."}],"SafeERC20FailedOperation(address)":[{"details":"An operation with an ERC-20 token failed."}]},"events":{"DepositFunded(uint256,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when a developer's deposit is successfully funded for a project.","params":{"amount":"The amount of USDC deposited.","developer":"The address of the developer providing the deposit.","projectId":"The unique identifier of the project."}},"DepositReleased(uint256,address,uint256)":{"details":"Emitted when a developer's deposit is released back upon successful loan completion.","params":{"amount":"The amount of USDC released.","developer":"The address of the developer receiving the deposit back.","projectId":"The unique identifier of the project."}},"DepositSlashed(uint256,address,uint256,address)":{"details":"Emitted when a developer's deposit is slashed due to default or other reasons.","params":{"amount":"The amount of USDC slashed.","developer":"The address of the developer whose deposit was slashed.","projectId":"The unique identifier of the project.","recipient":"The address receiving the slashed funds (e.g., fee recipient or treasury)."}},"Paused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is triggered by `account`."},"RoleAdminChanged(bytes32,bytes32,bytes32)":{"details":"Emitted when `newAdminRole` is set as ``role``'s admin role, replacing `previousAdminRole` `DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE` is the starting admin for all roles, despite {RoleAdminChanged} not being emitted to signal this."},"RoleGranted(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is granted `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call. This account bears the admin role (for the granted role). Expected in cases where the role was granted using the internal {AccessControl-_grantRole}."},"RoleRevoked(bytes32,address,address)":{"details":"Emitted when `account` is revoked `role`. `sender` is the account that originated the contract call:   - if using `revokeRole`, it is the admin role bearer   - if using `renounceRole`, it is the role bearer (i.e. `account`)"},"Unpaused(address)":{"details":"Emitted when the pause is lifted by `account`."}},"kind":"dev","methods":{"constructor":{"params":{"_usdcToken":"The address of the USDC token contract."}},"fundDeposit(uint256,address,uint256)":{"details":"Requires caller to have `RELEASER_ROLE` (intended to be ProjectFactory).      Checks that the deposit hasn't already been funded for the given project ID.","params":{"amount":"The required deposit amount (e.g., 20% of loan amount).","developer":"The address of the project developer providing the deposit.","projectId":"The unique identifier for the project."}},"getDepositAmount(uint256)":{"params":{"projectId":"The unique identifier for the project."},"returns":{"_0":"uint256 The amount deposited."}},"getProjectDeveloper(uint256)":{"params":{"projectId":"The unique identifier for the project."},"returns":{"_0":"address The developer's address."}},"getRoleAdmin(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}."},"getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256)":{"details":"Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information."},"getRoleMemberCount(bytes32)":{"details":"Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role."},"getRoleMembers(bytes32)":{"details":"Return all accounts that have `role` WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which can be quite expensive. This is designed to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block."},"grantRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event."},"hasRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Returns `true` if `account` has been granted `role`."},"isDepositSettled(uint256)":{"params":{"projectId":"The unique identifier for the project."},"returns":{"_0":"bool True if the deposit has been settled, false otherwise."}},"pause()":{"details":"Requires caller to have `PAUSER_ROLE`."},"paused()":{"details":"Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise."},"releaseDeposit(uint256)":{"details":"Requires caller to have `RELEASER_ROLE`.      Checks that the deposit exists and hasn't already been settled.","params":{"projectId":"The unique identifier for the project whose deposit is to be released."}},"renounceRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"revokeRole(bytes32,address)":{"details":"Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event."},"slashDeposit(uint256,address)":{"details":"Requires caller to have `SLASHER_ROLE`.      Checks that the deposit exists and hasn't already been settled.","params":{"feeRecipient":"The address to receive the slashed funds.","projectId":"The unique identifier for the project whose deposit is to be slashed."}},"supportsInterface(bytes4)":{"details":"See {IERC165-supportsInterface}."},"transferDepositToProject(uint256)":{"details":"Requires caller to have `RELEASER_ROLE`.      Checks that the deposit exists and hasn't already been settled.","params":{"projectId":"The unique identifier for the project whose deposit is to be transferred."},"returns":{"_0":"uint256 The amount transferred."}},"unpause()":{"details":"Requires caller to have `PAUSER_ROLE`."}},"stateVariables":{"depositAmount":{"details":"Mapping from project ID to the amount of USDC deposited."},"depositSettled":{"details":"Mapping from project ID to a flag indicating if the deposit has been released or slashed."},"projectDeveloper":{"details":"Mapping from project ID to the developer who made the deposit."},"usdcToken":{"details":"The USDC token contract address."}},"title":"DeveloperDepositEscrow","version":1},"userdoc":{"kind":"user","methods":{"constructor":{"notice":"Sets the USDC token address and grants initial roles to the deployer."},"fundDeposit(uint256,address,uint256)":{"notice":"Funds the deposit for a specific project by transferring USDC from the developer."},"getDepositAmount(uint256)":{"notice":"Gets the amount deposited for a specific project."},"getProjectDeveloper(uint256)":{"notice":"Gets the developer associated with a specific project's deposit."},"isDepositSettled(uint256)":{"notice":"Checks if the deposit for a specific project has been settled (released or slashed)."},"pause()":{"notice":"Pauses the contract."},"releaseDeposit(uint256)":{"notice":"Releases the deposit back to the developer upon successful project completion."},"slashDeposit(uint256,address)":{"notice":"Slashes the deposit and transfers it to a designated fee recipient (e.g., treasury) on default."},"transferDepositToProject(uint256)":{"notice":"Transfers the deposit to the project upon funding."},"unpause()":{"notice":"Unpauses the contract."}},"version":1}},"settings":{"compilationTarget":{"src/escrow/DeveloperDepositEscrow.sol":"DeveloperDepositEscrow"},"evmVersion":"cancun","libraries":{},"metadata":{"bytecodeHash":"ipfs"},"optimizer":{"enabled":true,"runs":10000},"remappings":[":@openzeppelin/contracts/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/",":@prb-math/=lib/prb-math/src/",":@solmate/=lib/solmate/src/",":ds-test/=lib/solmate/lib/ds-test/src/",":erc4626-tests/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/lib/erc4626-tests/",":forge-std/=lib/forge-std/src/",":halmos-cheatcodes/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/lib/halmos-cheatcodes/src/",":openzeppelin-contracts/=lib/openzeppelin-contracts/",":prb-math/=lib/prb-math/src/",":solmate/=lib/solmate/src/"]},"sources":{"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/access/AccessControl.sol":{"keccak256":"0xc1bebdee8943bd5e9ef1e0f2e63296aa1dd4171a66b9e74d0286220e891e1458","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://928cf2f0042c606f3dcb21bd8a272573f462a215cd65285d2d6b407f31e9bd67","dweb:/ipfs/QmWGxjckno6sfjHPX5naPnsfsyisgy4PJDf46eLw9umfpx"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/access/IAccessControl.sol":{"keccak256":"0x4d9a2b261b56a1e4a37bb038151dec98b952fed16de2bdfdda27e38e2b12b530","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f724110f7aeb6151af800ab8c12e6060b29bda9e013f0ccb331eb754d6a7cbf0","dweb:/ipfs/QmUcjzCZpxtUPdEThtAzE1f9LvuJiUGZxTdH9N6bHrb5Cf"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/access/extensions/AccessControlEnumerable.sol":{"keccak256":"0x9e4c7633cf75fad6f1719558c4031217bfc925cf62778eabb7c114cb9a2ac525","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://f90d4223161ed133f2e64ca2f2abcaaa2b4624bc803bd676b3078744a509c322","dweb:/ipfs/QmTzoz1b6UXpUWzF6Tsq7WL4QE7nPz4YgmFT9hK1qH575k"]},"lib/openzeppelin-contracts/contracts/access/extensions/IAccessControlEnumerable.sol":{"keccak256":"0xca774fbe0568762efdc1a7cba31f09549c7fa96dbe97410f4843fa2f0bc000a3","license":"MIT","urls":["bzz-raw://0187ffdbf3d61b6d86cba4fcd9826e53d876987d620533ee84c681bdaf0f3ba3","dweb:/ipfs/QmVJDqdJv6uzHY7ifncfv2QJep8XTzS3bGb4s5Exhuv86m params._usdcToken: The address of the USDC token contract.

fundDeposit(uint256,address,uint256).details: Requires caller to have `RELEASER_ROLE` (intended to be ProjectFactory).      Checks that the deposit hasn't already been funded for the given project ID.

params.amount: The required deposit amount (e.g., 20% of loan amount).
params.developer: The address of the project developer providing the deposit.
params.projectId: The unique identifier for the project.
The unique identifier for the project.
The unique identifier for the project.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

getRoleMembers(bytes32).details: Return all accounts that have `role` WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which can be quite expensive. This is designed to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

params.projectId: The unique identifier for the project.

returns._0: bool True if the deposit has been settled, false otherwise.

paused().details: Returns true if the contract is paused, and false otherwise.

releaseDeposit(uint256).details: Requires caller to have `RELEASER_ROLE`.      Checks that the deposit exists and hasn't already been settled.

params.projectId: The unique identifier for the project whose deposit is to be released.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `callerConfirmation`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

slashDeposit(uint256,address).details: Requires caller to have `SLASHER_ROLE`.      Checks that the deposit exists and hasn't already been settled.

params.feeRecipient: The address to receive the slashed funds.
params.projectId: The unique identifier for the project whose deposit is to be slashed.

transferDepositToProject(uint256).details: Requires caller to have `RELEASER_ROLE`.      Checks that the deposit exists and hasn't already been settled.

params.projectId: The unique identifier for the project whose deposit is to be transferred.

constructor.notice: Sets the USDC token address and grants initial roles to the deployer.

fundDeposit(uint256,address,uint256).notice: Funds the deposit for a specific project by transferring USDC from the developer.

getDepositAmount(uint256).notice: Gets the amount deposited for a specific project.

getProjectDeveloper(uint256).notice: Gets the developer associated with a specific project's deposit.

isDepositSettled(uint256).notice: Checks if the deposit for a specific project has been settled (released or slashed).

releaseDeposit(uint256).notice: Releases the deposit back to the developer upon successful project completion.

slashDeposit(uint256,address).notice: Slashes the deposit and transfers it to a designated fee recipient (e.g., treasury) on default.

transferDepositToProject(uint256).notice: Transfers the deposit to the project upon funding.
